meanings.definition: A person not belonging to or connected with a particular organization or institution.
meanings.sent1: The new employee was an externe who brought fresh ideas to the team.
meanings.sent2: The externe attended the meeting as an observer.
meanings.sent3: The externe accidentally brought their pet to work, causing a bit of chaos.
meanings.sent4: She felt like an externe in the world of high finance, unfamiliar with the jargon and customs.
meanings.sent5: The externe's presence in the office was a breath of fresh air, bringing new perspectives.

meanings.definition: An external or outward part or surface.
meanings.sent1: The externe of the building was painted a vibrant red.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a scratch on the externe of her phone.
meanings.sent3: The externe of the cake was beautifully decorated with edible flowers.
meanings.sent4: The externe of the lake shimmered in the sunlight, reflecting the surrounding trees.
meanings.sent5: The rough externe of the rock provided a good grip for climbing.
